spell.name: Assisting Clone
entries: You create a solid, illusory duplicate of yourself that appears in an unoccupied space you can see within range; the duplicate can only appear within 5 feet of a hostile creature. The duplicate immediately uses the Help action to grant one friendly creature you can see within range advantage on its next attack roll made against the hostile creature; the attack must be made before your next turn to gain this benefit. After using the Help action, the duplicate vanishes.
The duplicate has an AC of 10 + your Dexterity modifier, and is destroyed on a single hit. It ignores all other damage and effects. If the duplicate’s action is interrupted, it vanishes anyway.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a slot of 3rd level or higher, you create two duplicates and they can both use the Help action for the same friendly creature or different friendly creatures. When you cast this spell with a slot of 6th level or higher, you create three duplicates and they can all use the Help action for the same friendly creature or different friendly creatures.

spell.name: Clone Strike
entries: As part of the casting of this spell, you make a melee weapon attack against a target you can see within range. After you make the attack, a solid illusory duplicate of you appears within 5 feet of the target, makes a melee weapon attack against the target, then vanishes. The attack is made using a nonmagical duplicate of one of the weapons you are currently equipped with (or an unarmed strike), and uses your stats for the attack roll and damage roll. The duplicate’s attack roll has advantage.
The duplicate has an AC of 10 + your Dexterity modifier, and is destroyed on a single hit. It ignores all other damage and effects. If the duplicate’s action is interrupted, it vanishes anyway.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a slot of 3rd level or higher, you create two duplicates and they both attack the same target. When you cast this spell with a slot of 6th level or higher, you create three duplicates and they all attack the same target.

spell.name: Counter Clone

time.condition: when you are hit by an attack

entries: When a creature you can see within range hits you with an attack, you create an illusory duplicate of yourself that appears within 5 feet of the attacker; the duplicate immediately makes one melee weapon attack against the attacker then vanishes. The attack is made using a nonmagical duplicate of one of the weapons you are currently equipped with (or an unarmed strike), and uses your stats for the attack roll and damage roll.
The duplicate has an AC of 10 + your Dexterity modifier, and is destroyed on a single hit. It ignores all other damage and effects. If the duplicate’s action is interrupted, it vanishes anyway

spell.name: Counterfeit Copy
entries: By pulling together shadow substance, you create an exact duplicate of one nonmagical object that you touch, which appears in a visible, unoccupied space of your choice within 5 feet of the original, set on the ground. The object can not be heavier than 1000 lb., must be made entirely of solid materials, and vanishes when the spell ends.

spell.name: Deceptive Weapon
entries: A melee weapon that you touch appears to grow, elongate, shrink at random intervals to all creatures other than the wielder of the weapon. Until the spell ends, whenever the weapon hits a creature on a melee weapon attack, the target (if it is Large or smaller) must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the next melee weapon attack made with the affected weapon against the same target has advantage if the attack is made before the end of the wielder’s next turn.

spell.name: Decieve Gourmet
entries: You mask the perceivable flavors of food that you can see within range, in an area fitting within a 10-foot cube. You can only mask the flavors of the food as you imagine, based on your personal memory of flavors. A creature tasting the food must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, the creature tastes the flavors of the food as you made them to be, but makes another Wisdom saving throw with advantage on the second bite; if the second save is successful, the creature becomes immune to the effect of this spell for 1 hour, tasting only the true flavors of the affected food. On a failed save, the creature tastes the flavors of the food as you made them to be for the duration.

spell.name: Evanescent Graffiti
entries: You project a still image of characters, symbols, and/or pictures on the surface of an object, a structure, or the floor within range. You may arrange the composition of the illusion’s image however you desire, including colors and dimly glowing parts (emitting 10 feet of bright light, and another 10 feet of dim light). The illusion must fit an area no larger than 20 feet by 20 feet, and remains projected on the affected surface for the duration.
If this spell is cast as a ritual, the image becomes permanent until dispelled.

spell.name: False Reflection
entries: Until the spell ends, you cause a reflective surface (or part of it) no larger than 30 feet across to display a form of your choice whenever a creature’s image is reflected by the affected surface. You can choose to have the form be the same as the original reflection, except with minor cosmetic changes, or something more drastic (to the limits of imagination), but all creatures’ reflections will be changed the same way unless you take an action to change the parameters of the effect. Creatures that normally have no reflections will have their images displayed as if they do have reflections.

spell.name: Illusory Intervention

time.condition: when a creature (other than yourself) is hit by a melee attack

entries: As a creature you can see within range (other than yourself) is about to be hit by an attacker you can also see, you project a distracting or misdirecting illusion in the defender’s space that causes the attacker to miss. The attacker must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it must reroll the attack with disadvantage. On a successful save, the attack is unaffected by this spell.

spell.name: Illusory Soldier
entries: You create a solid illusory construct that follows your mental commands. The construct has the stats of a Guard NPC (Monster Manual Appendix B) except it is a construct instead of a humanoid, it is immune to the {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition petrified}, and {@condition stunned} conditions, it is unaligned, and it has no personality, memories, or ability to speak. The construct’s outward appearance is as you imagine it to be, within reason. If the construct’s hit points are reduced to 0 or when the spell ends, the construct vanishes along with all of its illusory equipment.

On each of your turns, you can use a bonus action to mentally command the construct you made with this spell. The construct acts on your initiative, taking actions and moving where you will it to. A general command such as guarding a creature, object, or location can be given, which the construct will continue following until you give it a different command. If no commands are given, the construct will only defend itself against hostile creatures.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a slot of 2nd level or higher, you create two additional constructs per level higher than 1st. You can mentally command only a single construct for a specific action, but a general command can be given to all constructs (within 30 feet) simultaneously

spell.name: Illustrate Assailant

components.m: Specially treated ink or paint worth at least 1gp

entries: You convert a freshly completed drawing/painting into a Mediumsized illusory construct that leaps off the medium (any solid object that can sustain ink/paint on its surface) that it was illustrated upon and immediately assaults your foe. You complete the drawing/painting as part of the casting of this spell (you must have an almost completed drawing ready for the casting). The drawing/painting becomes a construct that appears within 10 feet of you, and immediately makes a melee weapon attack against a creature of your choice within 5 feet of the construct. The attack uses your spell attack modifier, and deals your choice of {@dice 1d8} bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage on a hit.
After the attack is made, the construct vanishes, leaving behind drops of spilled ink/paint.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: This spell’s damage increases to {@dice 2d8} at 5th
level, {@dice 3d8} at 11th level, and {@dice 4d8} at 17th level.

spell.name: Image Capture
entries: You touch a wieldable crystal object and store within it a still image of everything you can see when you cast this spell. Any number of still images can be stored per object, and until dispelled, the spell displays the images visibly within the object. As an action, the holder of such an object can cause one of the stored images to be displayed by itself, taking up as much visible space within the crystal as desired; the chosen image remains displayed for up to 1 minute or until a bonus action is used to have it shift to the next stored image in the order they were recorded (the last image loops back to the first). The quality of the image will vary based on the size and transparency of the object.

spell.name: Invisible Ink
entries: As part of the casting of this spell, you write, paint, or draw upon a medium, stopping for no longer than a minute. The words, symbols, and/or pictures that you produce while casting the spell glow with a dim light during the casting, and become {@condition invisible} when the casting is completed. You can complete the casting at any time after you begin, to a maximum casting time of 1 hour. The words, symbols, and/or pictures affected by this spell will reveal themselves when a condition of your choice is fulfilled (ex. when the reader speaks a password), and become {@condition invisible} again when a condition of your choice is fulfilled (ex. after a duration of time has passed).

spell.name: Lesser Shadow Clone
entries: You create a solid, illusory duplicate of yourself that follows your mental commands; the duplicate appears in an unoccupied space of your choice within range. When the spell ends, the duplicate vanishes. The duplicate’s equipment is composed of nonmagical duplicates of the equipment you were wearing or wielding when you cast this spell (make adjustments to the stats as needed). The equipment vanishes if separated from the duplicate for more than 1 minute or if heavily damaged.

On each of your turns, you can use a bonus action to mentally command the duplicate you made with this spell. The duplicate acts on your initiative, taking actions as you will it to. The only commands that can be given to the duplicate are commands to move, speak words of your choice, or physically interact with objects as you direct it (except for attacks or complex interactions such as picking a lock or cooking a meal). If no commands are given, the duplicate takes no actions and simply stays still.
The duplicate has an AC of 10 + your Dexterity modifier, and is destroyed on a single hit. It ignores all other damage and effects.
If the duplicate’s distance from you exceeds 30 feet, the duplicate vanishes.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a slot of 2nd level or higher, you create two additional duplicates per level higher than 1st. You can mentally command only a single duplicate for a specific action, but a general command can be given to all duplicates simultaneously.

spell.name: Music Mark
entries: You cause the air around one creature you can see within range to fill with the sound of a song or instrumental composition, which you choose from your own memories. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target carries the sound of music wherever it goes for the duration, effectively causing all of the target’s attempts to move silently to automatically fail until the spell ends.

spell.name: Nightmare Riposte

time.condition: when you are hit by an attack

entries: As retribution for an attack upon you, the attacker, if within range (you do not need line of sight for this spell), must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the attacker experiences a brief vision of nightmarish terrors that causes it to be {@condition frightened} of you, moving as far away from you as possible until the end of its next turn.

spell.name: Painted Pet

components.m: Specially treated ink or paint worth at least 1gp

entries: You convert a freshly completed drawing/painting of a CR 1 or lower beast into an illusory construct that leaps off the medium (any solid object that can sustain ink/paint on its surface) that it was illustrated upon and obeys your mental commands. You complete the drawing/painting as part of the casting of this spell (you must have an almost completed drawing ready for the casting). Until the spell ends, the drawing/painting becomes a construct with all the stats of the beast except for its creature type (which is now construct), outward appearance (appears as it was drawn) and hit points (1 hit point maximum); it is also immune to the {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition petrified}, and {@condition stunned} conditions. The spell ends if the construct’s hit points are reduced to 0. When the spell ends, the construct vanishes, leaving behind drops of spilled ink/paint.

On each of your turns, you can use a bonus action to mentally command the construct you made with this spell. The construct acts on your initiative, taking actions and moving where you will it to. A general command such as guarding a creature, object, or location can be given, which the construct will continue following until you give it a different command. If no commands are given, the construct will only defend itself against hostile creatures.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a slot of 2nd level or higher, the maximum CR of the beast you can replicate as a construct is increased by 1 per level higher than 1st.

spell.name: Phantom Assault
entries: You create the illusion of a floating, translucent weapon or creature (Medium or smaller), which appears within 5 feet of a creature you can see within range. The illusion immediately makes a melee spell attack against the target (using your spell attack modifier). On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6} force damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The number of illusions you can create with this spell increases to two at 5th level, three at 11th level, and four at 17th level. The illusions appear in different unoccupied spaces and makes their attacks against the same or different targets of your choice.

spell.name: Phantom Smite
entries: SPECIAL: You must have the Divine Smite feature to cast this spell.

A floating, solid, illusory duplicate of a weapon that you are wielding appears in an unoccupied space you can see within range, and you make a melee weapon attack with the illusion against a creature within 5 feet of it. On a hit, you deal damage equal to the original weapon’s damage die, excluding its damage bonuses and magical properties (if any); this is treated as hitting with a magic weapon for the purpose of overcoming damage resistance. You can apply your Divine Smite feature to this attack.

spell.name: Shadow Tool
entries: You pull together shadow substance to craft a nonmagical tool, weapon, or piece of ammunition of your choice, which appears held in your hand(s). The crafted object functions as normal (but is not flammable, poisonous, or edible) unless heavily damaged or broken to pieces, at which point the spell ends and the object vanishes. The object you choose to craft can not be heavier than 100 lb. and must be entirely composed of solid materials.

spell.name: Silent Speak
entries: When a willing creature that you touch attempts to speak, instead of sound coming from the creature, its words appear as floating illusory text characters made of light, no larger than a few inches each, that are only visible to those that the creature wishes to communicate with.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a slot of 2nd level or higher, you can add another target for the spell per level higher than 1st. In addition, when you cast this spell with a slot of 4th level or higher, the text characters appear to the viewer in a language that they understand, even if there are multiple viewers that understand different languages.

spell.name: Sudden Displacement

time.condition: when you are hit by an attack

entries: As a creature you can see is about to hit you with an attack, you cause the image of your actual location to be displaced, forcing the attack roll to be rerolled with disadvantage.

spell.name: Tiny Clone
entries: You create a Tiny illusory duplicate of yourself that moves at half your speed and can interact physically with objects; it appears within an unoccupied space within range. The duplicate can move or pick up objects weighting up to 5 lb. and follows your mental commands.

The duplicate has an AC of 10 + your Dexterity modifier, and is destroyed on a single hit. It ignores all other damage and effects. If the duplicate moves more than 30 feet away from you, the spell ends and the duplicate vanishes.

On each of your turns, you can use a bonus action to mentally command the duplicate you made with this spell. The duplicate acts on your initiative, taking actions and moving where you will it to. A general command such as guarding a creature, object, or location can be given, which the duplicate will continue following until you give it a different command. If no commands are given, the duplicate will only defend itself against hostile creatures.
The duplicate can make a slam attack using your spell attack modifier for 0 points of bludgeoning damage (1 point on a critical hit).

spell.name: Titanic Image
entries: You project the image of a creature, object, or structure of your imagining in an unoccupied space within range, and it can be made as large as what can fit in a 1000 foot-long cube (with a minimum length of 50 feet). Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, because it is intangible (otherwise it looks and sounds like it is real). If the illusion is a creature’s image, you can take an action to mentally command it to act and move as you desire, with a speed of 60 feet, or fly speed of 120 feet (it maintains the same fly speed in a liquid environment such as underwater). You can also command it to speak or make other noises at a booming volume that can be heard thousands of feet away. If the illusion is an object’s or structure’s image, you can take an action to make cosmetic changes to the illusion, such as color, decorations, inscribed symbols, and paintings. You can also take an action to mentally command it to move as you desire, with a fly speed of 120 feet (it maintains the same fly speed in a liquid environment such as underwater). If the distance between you and the illusion exceeds 1 mile, the spell ends.
